data.title: Let's talk about 2002.
data.meta_description:
Man probably the peak of "childhood gaming" for me.

I was PC only then. Warcraft 3, Morrowind, Neverwinter Nights, Icewind Dale 2, Jedi Outcast, Allied...
data.text:
Man probably the peak of "childhood gaming" for me.

I was PC only then. Warcraft 3, Morrowind, Neverwinter Nights, Icewind Dale 2, Jedi Outcast, Allied Assault, UT2K3 all loom large.

And then later when I got into consoles it was basically because of Metroid Prime.

But that summer of WarCraft 3, Morrowind, and Neverwinter Nights, combined with the rest of life as a teenager.. yep. Nostalgia bomb for sure.

I didn't include multiplatforms. Morrowind was Xbox console exclusive. You might add Steel Battalion and Shenmue II too but Shenmue II was on Dreamcast and was Steel Battalion iconic?

Oh I don't doubt your choices for the list I'm just remarking because looking back it's kind of amazing Xbox survived against the PS2. So many notable franchises skipped that system.

It was a really good year especially on PS2.

The list in the op doesn't even mention lot of the noteworthy PS2 releases like Aggressive Inline, Contra: Shattered Soldier, The Mark of Kri, Rygar: The Legendary Adventure, The Thing (multiplatform) and Wipeout Fusion.

Then there are also more niche cult stuff like Shinobi, Way of the Samurai, Gungrave and Armored Core 3.

Wow. So many great games.

My most played game from that year:

Heroes IV

My favorite game from then:

Kingdom Hearts

Shout out for:

Super Mario Sunshine, Icewindale 2, Vice City, Battlefield 1942, LOTR the Two Towers and Sly Cooper

So many games I played from this list.

Warcraft III: Reign of Chaos

Neverwinter Nights

Age of Mythology

Dungeon Siege

Unreal Tournament 2003

Metroid Prime

Super Mario Sunshine

GTA: Vice City

Ratchet & Clank

Kingdom Hearts

The Elder Scrolls III: Morrowind

No idea where I found either the time or the money. Nowadays I barely play a handful of new releases per year.

On PS2, I think was mostly still playing games I got from previous year.

On PC, I'd pickup No One Lives Forever 2...my PC was able run it, but with terrible performance thanks to the wonderful GeForce 2 MX I got stuck with lol.

That year must've been like diametrically opposed to my tastes because there's almost nothing listed in this that that I played much less liked lol.

Man, imagine someone telling me in 2002 that there would never be a game with Cate Archer again. Goddamn it.

Maybe someday...

Nightdive Studios Wants to Remaster No One Lives Forever

Nightdive Studios has appealed to Warner Bros. Games to let the studio remaster PS2 classic The Operative: No One Lives Forever and players are being encouraged to help. Nightdive CEO Stephen Kick sent a cheeky tweet to the publisher, a similar tactic used to ask Disney to let them remaster Star...

Maybe someday...

Nightdive Studios Wants to Remaster No One Lives Forever

Nightdive Studios has appealed to Warner Bros. Games to let the studio remaster PS2 classic The Operative: No One Lives Forever and players are being encouraged to help. Nightdive CEO Stephen Kick sent a cheeky tweet to the publisher, a similar tactic used to ask Disney to let them remaster Star...

I'll never stop beliving.

I just finished Halo yesterday in co-op. I'm 22 yars late to the party... 2022 was the year Halo launched here in Europe. Same year Timesplitters 2 came out.

Early 2000s were the highest highs in gaming for me back then: 3D gaming maturing, lots of innovations /standards settling... online gaming really becoming mainstream.

2002 was an okay year. I think nostalgia clouds people's judgement of games from this era.

Personally, as a kid I was playing Super Mario Sunshine and Metroid Prime on the GC.

I was 21 in 2002. Metroid Prime and Eternal Darkness are 2 of the best games ever. But 2002 was really probably not a good year overall. It was right after one of the very best years of 2001.
